news_header: Ecuador's presidential election will go to a second round after a tight first round, with incumbent Daniel Noboa and challenger Luisa González nearly tied in votes.
news_original_title: Ecuador election ends in a 'tie' prompting run-off
news_text: Ecuador's presidential election is heading to a second round after a closely contested first round resulted in a 'technical tie' between incumbent Daniel Noboa and left-wing challenger Luisa González. With over 94% of votes counted, Noboa received 44.2% and González 43.9%. Noboa's presidency has focused on tackling gang violence, while González criticizes him for failing to deliver on key promises. The second round will be crucial as both candidates face significant challenges, including rampant crime and economic instability.
